txt.en: 'I don't know.'
'Sometimes I wonder if Govard was the luckiest of us, after all.'
'But I am glad Rúvaran has taken it away.'
'There are some warding runes preventing passage to a sacred lake of the dwarves.'
Loud mechanisms operate noisily inside Tûr Fúar, but the halls are empty
'He plans to break them with the Máltagar.'
'I knew it was a trap!'
'I wonder?'
'Hmmm.'
'[placeholder]! We're through! Are you safe?'
'We are trying to be stealthy here, Imák.'
'Let's go... but remain alert.'
'Wait, friends.'
With a crash, Imák and Venko break through the gate!
Talk to Venko beside the side entrance to Drearspire
Enter the Drearspire with Imák and Venko
Talk to Imák inside the Drearspire
Explore the Drearspire with Imák and Venko
Talk to Venko inside the Drearspire
Eavesdrop on the discussion between the cultists in the Drearspire
You have entered the Drearspire with Imák and Venko, in search of answers: what villainy have the Angmarim conducted within Câr Bronach?
You have entered the Drearspire with Imák and Venko and should search the tower for answers.
Inside the Drearspire, Venko has called for you to halt.

You have entered the Drearspire with Imák and Venko, and now you have the opportunity to eavesdrop on some of the Angmarim who remain in the tower. Perhaps you will learn what these evil folk seek to accomplish within Câr Bronach, and elsewhere.\n\nYou must not be seen by the Angmarim cultists.
'No. What did you hear?'
'You've been jumpy ever since you came back from Barad Gúlaran.'
Talk to Imák outside the Drearspire
'What happened to you, Covairë?'
Follow Imák and Venko toward the Drearspire
'Ailgar called it the Fell Graver.'
'But she died months ago.'
You have come with Imák and Venko to Tûr Fúar, the Drearspire, to learn if an Angmarim ritual is behind the curious happenings within Câr Bronach.
'But how?'
'Over there! A side door we can use!'
'You think the Fell Graver showed her to you?'

'The snow has begun. It is not yet very heavy, but if it gets worse perhaps it will mask our approach.

'Let us try to do this without fighting, if we can. I wager the answers we seek will be on an upper level of the tower, and the further we can get without making noise, the more we will learn.

'Agreed? Good.'
'This way, you two.'
'What does he plan to do with it?'

'Still we have seen no guards, and it seems to me we might have walked right up to the front door of the tower, if that was our wish! We have either been very fortunate to this point... or it is a trap.\n\n'Let us use this side entrance. It may allow us to surprise any Angmarim that might lie in ambush for us within the Drearspire.'
'Hmmm?'
'Well, good luck to him.'
'Did you hear that?'
'What's in here?'
'I'm not sure. Maybe it was nothing.'

'A tower of this size could hold a battalion of Angmarim, [placeholder], and our prior scouting revealed that recently it did! Where then have the cultists gone?\n\n'Let us proceed, and let caution be the watch-word.'
'[placeholder]! Look out!'
'Ever since we brought the Máltagar here...'
'Aye, Venko. But for whom was it set?'
'Aye.'
'You'd better search that room for a way to open the gate, [placeholder].'
'I don't like it, Mornair.'
'We'll do the same out here.'
'You know I fear nothing! But there's something wrong with that artifact.'

'The snow has begun. It is not yet very heavy, but if it gets worse perhaps it will mask our approach.

'Let us try to do this without fighting, if we can. I wager the answers we seek will be on an upper level of the tower, and the further we can get without making noise, the more we will learn.

'Will this be a problem, Brawler?'
'Well-fought, my brawling friend!'
'I only carried it for a short time, but even that was too long.'
'DNT - Blah!'
'Let's go.'
'It's awfully quiet.'
'Did I tell you I saw Govard?'
'I saw her standing not ten feet from me, just as she was in life.'
'Onward... but remain alert!'
'Fine. But don't be long.'

'Still we have seen no guards, and it seems to me we might have walked right up to the front door of the tower, if that was our wish! We have either been very fortunate to this point... or it is a trap.\n\n'Let us use this side entrance. It may allow us to surprise any Angmarim that might lie in ambush for us within the Drearspire.'

'A tower of this size could hold a battalion of Angmarim, [placeholder], and our prior scouting revealed that recently it did! Where then have the cultists gone?\n\n'Let us proceed, and let caution be the watch-word.'
'DNT - Blah!'
'DNT - Blah!'
'This side door seems promising... and unguarded!'
'Welcome, [placeholder], welcome.'
'I am called Ailgar, and this is my domain.'

'I hear the voices of Angmarim from just ahead, [placeholder]. Let us advance, slowly, and see if we can eavesdrop on their conversation. Let us remain out of sight and we may learn what they seek to do here in Câr Bronach, and elsewhere.'

He turns to address your Stout-axe companion.

'Imák, you stay here and guard the path of our escape, in the event we need it. But we will try to avoid being seen by these villains.

'Come, [placeholder], and make as little noise as possible!'
'Am I to understand you are a Brawler?'
'Can one such as you defy my finest servants?'

'Our investigation has borne fruit, [placeholder]: it seems the strange occurrences within Câr Bronach are not entirely understood by the Angmarim cultists themselves.

'But there is reason for us to leave this tower, and with haste! The Angmarim leader Rúvaran now possesses an artifact with which he hopes to break the runes on Gloomingtarn, where stand the still waters of the sacred lake of Durin!

'We will set aside the mysteries of Câr Bronach for now. Rúvaran and his Angmarim must be opposed!'
'Your success surprises me, [placeholder].'
'Rúvaran spoke of your martial skill, but I did not believe him.'
<rgb=#FF0000>Avoid being seen by the Angmarim cultists</rgb>
'He has left on an errand of his own, and I must go to join him.'
'I challenge you not to die before we meet again, Brawler.'

'I hear the voices of Angmarim from just ahead, [placeholder]. Let us advance, slowly, and see if we can eavesdrop on their conversation. Let us remain out of sight and we may learn what they seek to do here in Câr Bronach, and elsewhere.'

He turns to address your companion.

'Imák, you stay here and guard the path of our escape, in the event we need it. But we will try to avoid being seen by these villains.

'Come, [placeholder], and make as little noise as possible!'
Instance: A Silent Presence
Imák and Venko wait for you on the hill upon which the Drearspire stands.
The words of Galadriel before her Mirror surface in your memory.
Imák and Venko hope your presence in the Drearspire will go unnoticed as you investigate the Angmarim interest in the tower.
'The tower claws the sky, unhidden by the falling snow.'
Venko stands before a side entrance to the Drearspire, considering its suitability for your purpose.
'Hearts hardened by defeat burn there, white-hot with vengeance.'
'Beware the place of jungle, where rot festers in stately lines.'
'With friends you dared the climb, yet you are alone in the trap.'
You have entered the Drearspire with Imák and Venko, in search of answers: what villainy have the Angmarim conducted within Câr Bronach?
'I'll not apologize. Some things are worth celebrating!'
'But I will be a silent presence from here on out.'
'Fine. Wait, is this because you think I can't be quiet?'
Mornair
Covairë
'Where have the guards gone?'
'I'll not complain... but it is strange.'
'Over here! A side door we can use!'
